Guides

Published

February 8, 2024

Our guides offer step-by-step instructions for frequent tasks you perform on the ValidMind platform, organized by category:

  • Onboarding
  • Model inventory
  • Model documentation
  • Model validation
ValidMind concepts
Model documentation
The purpose of model documentation is to provide transparency, facilitate understanding, and enable effective governance and oversight of the model. Provides a comprehensive record and description of a quantitative model. Should encompass all relevant information about the model in accordance with:
  • Intended use
  • Regulatory requirements set by regulatory bodies
  • Model risk policies set by your institution
  • Assumptions
  • Methodologies
  • Data and inputs
  • Model performance evaluation
  • Limitations
Documentation project
All documentation work in ValidMind is organized into projects which act as a container for the model documentation and validation report of your model. Each stage of the model’s lifecycle constitutes a new project and can be configured with its own templates and workflows.
Documentation Template
Functions as a test suite and lays out the structure of model documentation, segmented into various sections and sub-sections. ValidMind templates come with pre-defined sections, similar to test placeholders, including boilerplates and spaces designated for documentation and test results.

Model documentation is populated when the tests contained in a template run successfully, completing the test suite. This process ensures that the model meets all the specified requirements. At the same time, template placeholders get populated with content that documents the model. This content is generated by the ValidMind Developer Framework, providing a coherent structure for model information.

Essentially, our platform scans these templates, identifies all tests, and systematically organizes them into a well-structured test suite. This automation enhances the efficiency and consistency of the validation process.

The criteria for these templates are typically provided by your model risk management team. We provide some templates out of the box that you can use and programmatically customize to suit the requirements of each model use case. This task of customization is usually performed by an administrator, who ensures that the templates align with the organizational standards and specific needs of each model.

Tests
A function contained in the ValidMind Developer Framework, which is designed to run a specific quantitative test on the dataset or model. Test results are sent to the ValidMind Platform to generate the model documentation according to the relevant templates.
Test suites
A collection of tests which are meant to run together to automate generate model documentation end-to-end for specific use-cases.

Example: the classifier_full_suite test suite runs the tests from the tabular_dataset and classifier test suites to fully document the data and model sections for binary classification model use-cases.

Onboarding

To onboard your company and users onto the ValidMind platform:

Set up your organization

Configure the platform
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed faucibus, urna vel dignissim fringilla, est justo rhoncus ex, nec gravida eros nisl a nisi. Suspendisse potenti.
Onboarding users
Onboarding users involves controlling and organizing who has access to the ValidMind platform. Tasks include inviting your initial users, creating groups, and assigning roles and permissions.
Configure AWS PrivateLink
To keep your network traffic private and minimizes its attack surface, configure AWS PrivateLink to establish a private connection between ValidMind and your company network.

Model inventory

Customize model inventory fields
Edit individual model detailed fields in the model inventory to customize them to your needs. This topic is relevant for model owners who want to make model details are accurate and up to date in the Inventory.
Customize model registration form
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed faucibus, urna vel dignissim fringilla, est justo rhoncus ex, nec gravida eros nisl a nisi. Suspendisse potenti.
Register models in the inventory
To be able to document models, you need to register them in the model inventory. This topic is relevant for model owners who want to enable their model development teams to use ValidMind’s model documentation and validation features.

Model documentation

To document and test your models in your own model development environment:

Get started with the ValidMind Developer Framework
As a model developer, you use the ValidMind Developer Framework to automate the generation of model documentation by uploading documentation artifacts and test results to the ValidMind platform.
Code samples
Our code samples, based on Jupyter notebooks, showcase the capabilities and features of the ValidMind Developer Framework and platform, while also providing you with useful examples that you can build on and adapt for your own use cases.
No matching items

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed faucibus, urna vel dignissim fringilla, est justo rhoncus ex, nec gravida eros nisl a nisi. Suspendisse potenti.

Create documentation projects
Documentation projects enable you to upload documentation and test results for a specific model, to review and validate models, and to prepare validation reports.
Working with documentation project templates
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed faucibus, urna vel dignissim fringilla, est justo rhoncus ex, nec gravida eros nisl a nisi. Suspendisse potenti.
Working with model documentation
After you have uploaded documentation to a project through the developer framework, you can use the Platform UI to make qualitative edits to model documentation, view guidelines, collaborate with validators, and submit your project for approval.
Export documentation
If you need access to your model model documentation or validation reports outside of the ValidMind platform, you can export your documentation project files in Word or PDF format.

Preparing validation reports
As part of preparing validation reports, you can view the guidelines, collaborate with model developers, add or edit content, link evidence to your report, or work with project findings.
Export documentation
If you need access to your model model documentation or validation reports outside of the ValidMind platform, you can export your documentation project files in Word or PDF format.
